alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:27PM EST until February 18 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until late Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 31.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM EST Friday was 31.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 32.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 32.0 feet on 12/16/1951. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by 12 pm est Saturday.
